_description: On speaking and keeping silent — one couplet translating ‘Scire loquir decus est decus est et scire tacere / Hec duo si poteris scire peritus eris’ which precedes it in John Grimestone’s sermon notebook

NLS18721.Transcription:
Kunne to speke worchipe is worchipe is cunne be stille[Þ]is to
                    ȝif þu cunne mith no word ne nsaltu neuere spille
NLS18721.Editions:
Wilson,  Edward. 
             A Descriptive Index of the English Lyrics in John of Grimestone’s
                Preaching Book.
Medium Ævum Monographs
         n.s. 2. Oxford, 1973: 61.
